moves.3... c5 4. c3 Nc6 5. Nf3 Bg4 6. Be2 e6 7: an interesting move.  It offers to swop queens with double pawns, opening the a file
moves.10. axb3 Bxf3 11. Bxf3 a6: attemps to protect the a pawn
moves.13... f6: attemps to open up the centre
moves.16. Rxa6 Nd7 17. Rea1: doubles up rooks in an attempt to smach down the a file
moves.18... O-O 19. Rxc8 Rxc8 20. dxc5 bxc5 21: white lets the d pawn run too far, he is now losing
In this position, I (white) was planning 40...Kxc4 41.Nxd2 Nxd2 42. Rc3  Kd4 43. Kxd2 in a position which is dead even.

But what should have happened is that, if my opponent had declined the draw, is 40...Re6 ! 41. Kd1 Re1  42. Kc2 d1=Q   (pointed out by ionadowman)
